definitions.text: a vague idea in which some confidence is placed
examples: his impression of her was favorable
what are your feelings about the crisis?
it strengthened my belief in his sincerity
I had a feeling that she was lying
I wanted to create an impression of success
she retained that bold effect in her reproductions of the original painting

definitions.text: a clear and telling mental image
examples: he described his mental picture of his assailant
he had no clear picture of himself or his world
the events left a permanent impression in his mind

definitions.text: a concavity in a surface produced by pressing
examples: he left the impression of his fingers in the soft mud

definitions.text: a symbol that is the result of printing or engraving
examples: he put his stamp on the envelope

definitions.text: all the copies of a work printed at one time
examples: they ran off an initial printing of 2000 copies

definitions.text: (dentistry) an imprint of the teeth and gums in wax or plaster
examples: the dentist took an impression for use in preparing an inlay

definitions.text: an impressionistic portrayal of a person
examples: he did a funny impression of a politician

definitions.text: the act of pressing one thing on or into the surface of another
examples: he watched the impression of the seal on the hot wax
